884290645:
[

LECTURER/SENIOR LECTURER

Company Name University of Melbourne Company Location Parkville , Melbourne, VIC 3010, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 108 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Melbourne School of Engineering (MSE)


Salary: $98,775 - $117,290 p.a.(Level B) or $120,993 - $139,510 p.a. (Level C), plus 17% superannuation. Level of appointment is subject to qualifications and experience.


About University of Melbourne
The University of Melbourne is consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, at number 1 in Australia and number 32 in the world (Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2017-2018). We are globally engaged, comprehensive, research-intensive and committed to respond to the major social, economic and environmental challenges of our time.


About Melbourne School of Engineering (MSE)
MSE is entering an exciting juncture as we work towards transforming engineering and IT research and teaching, guided by MSE 2025, our ten-year strategic plan. With an expected investment of $1 billion in people and infrastructure, we are creating the entrepreneurial leaders and technology of the future — the people and things that will drive innovation and productivity to make a sustainable impact on the world in which we live. MSE continues to attract the best staff and students with a global reputation and has a commitment to knowledge for the betterment of society. It’s an incredibly exciting time to be joining MSE.


About the School of Computing and Information Systems (CIS)
CIS are international research leaders and are focused on delivering impact in three key areas: data and knowledge, platforms and systems, and people and organisations. In this discipline, the School was ranked number 1 in Australia and 13th in the world in the 2016 QS World University Ranking exercise.


The Opportunity
Want to change the world? Or are you thinking even bigger? At the School of Computing and Information Systems, you'll find smart people, big problems, and plenty of opportunities to make a real difference in the world. CIS are now seeking outstanding academic talent from around the world in areas ranging from computer science, information systems and software engineering.


With multiple positions available for Lecturers and Senior Lecturers, our academics help to enrich collaborative, interdisciplinary research and teaching across our departments and should always be thinking about new ways to help our students grow and share their passion for empowering them to unlock their full potential.


We are interested in speaking to candidates who are experienced in the following areas:

  • Health informatics
  • Digital health
  • Business information systems
  • Software engineering
  • Cybersecurity


Whilst these areas are of particular interest, exceptional candidates from all areas of computer science and information systems will be considered especially those with research experience in high-performance and distributed systems.


What you’ll be doing \xa0\xa0
You will be encouraged to collaborate in research within the School, the University, and industry and government agencies. You will be an aspiring leader in Computer Science or Information Systems research, with ambition to publish in high quality journals and conferences, mentor research students, and secure independent grant funding to support a program of research. You will be expected to develop a research portfolio and contribute to teaching in undergraduate and graduate programs within the School.

How to Apply
Apply online and complete the application form.

You are not required to upload a resume or address the selection criteria for this position. You are only required to complete the online application form.


While we take a look at your application, get to know us more and find out what it’s like working at MSE by visiting http://www.eng.unimelb.edu.au/about/join-mse/why-join-mse


The University of Melbourne and MSE is strongly committed to supporting diversity and flexibility in the workplace. Applications for part-time or other flexible working arrangements will be welcomed and will be fully considered subject to meeting the inherent requirements of the position.


Close date: 21 Oct 2018


For full position information and to apply online go to :
http://jobs.unimelb.edu.au/caw/en/job/897457/lecturersenior-lecturer

Job Description

McArthur is looking for experienced social welfare professionals to work on a casual on-call roster across state wide locations providing 24/7 support in residential care.

Suitable staff will be required to assist with supervised access visits, transport children and adolescence, providing family support and working within residential care environments

This is a fantastic opportunity for experienced residential and social welfare support workers with at least 12 months experience working with children, young people, families and adults across a wide range of leading service providers.

Opportunities to work within child protection, drug and alcohol support, mental health, crisis accommodation and youth and adult based residential care environments.

What We Are Looking For
  • Suitable applicants will need to be experienced with children from 0-18 years of age and have appropriate experience and knowledge of child welfare, child protection services and legislation.
  • Proven experience working with young people and adults within a residential care environment

  • The ability to remain calm in a crisis
  • An open-minded approach to supporting people with behavioural issues and complex needs.
  • The capacity to adapt to changing work environments.
  • Have great communication skills with the ability to engage well with people and work well with other staff.
  • Flexibility to work with a range of different shifts including active stand-up and sleepover shifts- this is essential.
  • Suitable applicants will need to have a minimum availability of three days per week.


Suitable Applicants Must Have
  • Bachelor of Social Work, Psychology or a minimum Diploma of Community Services
  • Minimum 12 months paid sector related experience
  • Current WWCC

Support Worker - Domestic Assistance

Company Name Calvary Health Care Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Advertisement

About The Role

We are looking for Support Workers across the Marrondah Council area and the outer Eastern suburbs including Ringwood, Croydon, Bayswater and Surrounding Suburbs to join our dedicated team where “Being for Others” is our Mission and our difference. This rewarding role will support our clients with a range of Domestic Assistance services to enable independence, improve social connections and promote positive health and well-being in both the community and clients homes.

As a Support Worker you will have 24/7 support from our Head Office Support Team (including clinical services), regular access to your supervisor and team meetings, attractive salary packaging options, access to an Employee Assistance program and opportunities to participate in and be rewarded through our Employee Recognition program.

What You Bring

We are looking for Support Workers who have the following:
  • Current First Aid Certificate (or willingness to obtain one)
  • Current Victorian Working With Children Check (or willingness to obtain one)
  • Current Australian Drivers Licence, reliable insured motor vehicle and smart mobile phone/device
  • Computer literacy and access to emails/internet
  • Flexible availability to cover a range of shifts

In return you will have ongoing training to develop your skills, career progression opportunities and a satisfying and fulfilling work life.

Benefits

This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a leading mission based health care organisation. We offer paid parental leave, salary packaging, career progression, flexible working hours and training and skills development. Calvary is also proud to be recognised as a leader in gender equality. Further details are available here: https://www.calvarycare.org.au/careers/benefits/

About Calvary

Calvary is a national Catholic provider of health, community and aged care services operating in six states and territories. Our services include public and private hospital care, acute and sub-acute care, home care services and retirement and aged care services, in both rural and metropolitan areas. Calvary employs over 11,000 people and has over 1,500 volunteers.

Calvary continues the mission of the Sisters of the Little Company of Mary, a mission focused on caring for those who are sick, dying and in need. We express our values of hospitality, healing, stewardship and respect through “being for others” exemplified by the Spirit of Calvary and the example of Venerable Mary Potter .

How To Join The Team

To join our diverse, compassionate and dedicated team for a rewarding Calvary career, please submit an online application.

As part of the application process, you may be required to participate in a health evaluation, which could include face to face assessment, psychometric and drug and alcohol testing, to ensure your suitability for the role.

Please note we are unable to accept emailed applications or resumes and phone calls from recruitment agencies.

Our values of Hospitality, Healing, Stewardship and Respect underpin all that we do. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and support applications by people from various life experiences, cultures and faiths and work together to provide options that empower and enrich our clients.

Job description

At Terra Firma we are all about making a positive difference for our clients, our consultants and our community.


What will you be doing?


Our clients range across industry sectors, and the engagements are diverse and varied, so you could be on client site supporting the implementation of security initiatives to ensure company and customers assets and information are secure, working on a project to grow customer advocacy or assisting an organisation to adopt new ways of working. And that’s just the start!


Is this you?


We are seeking skilled professionals who are passionate about generating meaningful change for clients and who are keen to belong to a company committed to bringing out their best, and supporting them along the way.


  • You are excited by the diversity that consulting offers
  • You are confident of your abilities to build and manage stakeholder relationships at all levels
  • You can quickly adapt to new environments and comfortably grasp new tools and concepts
  • You enjoy the challenge of problem-solving and thrive on innovation and creativity


What skills do you need?


  • You have a thorough working knowledge of current change management practices
  • You have significant project based organisational change management / change analysis experience preferably within a consulting environment
  • You have experience performing cross functional analysis across people, process and systems, and applying change management and business readiness tools and methodologies
  • You will have worked on large transformation projects and/or regulatory projects which impact large stakeholder groups
  • You will have developed training material and facilitated training that matched the business need
  • Ideally you will have worked in the Financial Services, Telecoms, Government or similar sectors
  • You may have, or be well on the way to having, accreditation in a leading Change Management Methodology e.g. PROSCI, PCI

Job description

工作地点：中国天津

Location: Tianjin, China

\xa0

岗位职责Responsibility:

根据公司业务战略和经营计划，结合品牌战略，制定全球产品战略并在区域范围内组织实施.

Define regional product strategy and implement it globally based on company’s business strategy, operation plan and brand strategy.

\xa0

1. \xa0 \xa0 产品规划及生命周期管理：组织完成全球产品战略的规划（含产品线的策划），经审批后，推动实施；监控产品管理制度和日常审批流程体系的顺利运作；批准新品开发上市；批准并组织实施老品退市、产品升级；管理各产品线的生命周期，包括跟进各产品在区域的销售情况，完成销售分析，为产品管理决策提供依据。

Product planning and product lifespan management:\xa0

\xa01.1 lead to define and implement global product strategy (including product line);\xa0

1.2 Monitor product management regulations and daily examination and approval procedures to make sure all the procedure run smoothly;\xa0

1.3 manage new product development and launching;

\xa01.4 organize and conduct product upgrading and discontinuing;\xa0

1.5 manage lifespan of all product lines, including following up with sales status of products in different regions and analyzing sales figures to provide reference for product management decisions.

2. \xa0 \xa0 产品定价和价格调整：按照市场价格需求，与区域市场部门、集团总部的财务部门一道，把控产品毛利底线，协调相同单品在不同国家的定价; 对区域导入品的定价，提出政策要求或指导意见\xa0

Product pricing and price adjusting:\xa0

\xa02.1 coordinate with finance and marketing departments to control the gross margin of each SKU in different regions;\xa0

\xa02.2 ODM and OEM product management in regions.

3. \xa0 \xa0 产品推广：审核整合后的产品故事、卖点、功效等内容，给予适当、准确的产品定位；审核产品推广方案（包括配套的产品文宣资料），督促执行；跟进产品的推广效果，持续改进产品推广流程。

Product promoting:

\xa03.1 define product positioning by integrating product stories, unique selling proposition, function, etc.;\xa0

3.2 plan and manage the product promotion in the regions, manage and monitor each product launching plans (including the promotion materials); 3.3 oversee and improve the product promotion process

\xa0

任职资格Requirements：

1. \xa0 \xa0 本科学历，具有海外学习背景\xa0

Possess a bachelor degree or above;oversea study experience will be a plus;

2. \xa0 \xa0 15年以上大型跨国企业相关工作经验（快消品、保健品或化妆品行业，安利、康宝莱、宝洁、玫琳凯、雅芳），有2年以上直销行业工作经验更佳\xa0

At least 15 years’ experience in product management of multinational companies (consumer goods, healthcare and wellness or beauty industry, preferable experience in Amway, Herbalife, P&G, MaryKey, Avon) , and at least 2 years’ experience in large direct selling (Multi-level marketing) enterprise;

3. \xa0 \xa0 能熟练用英语做工作语言；持国外护照，方便国际出差旅行\xa0

Excellent in both written and oral communication skills in English

4. \xa0 \xa0 熟悉保健品、化妆品行业产品标准，具备丰富的新产品市场推广知识；在直销国际化营销,策略规划.项目领导,中国保健食品注册,人才管理等方面有专长；

Familiar with dietary supplements and cosmetics industry standards；expertise in mark promotion of new product;expertise in global marketing,strategicplaning, project management, healthcare and wellness product registration and human resource management.

5. \xa0 \xa0 具有国际市场.海外协调工作经验，熟悉国内外保健食品.保健用品.食品.药品.化妆品,日化用品行业市场，有产品管理.产品培训及产品分析相关专业知识；

have experience in international marketing development and promotion

带领团队进行产品开发，并具有灵活机敏的危机处理意识；

be able to do product R&D with a team, and handle emergency and crisis.

Asset Investment Analyst / Business Analyst
Reporting to Asset Investment Manager, we have an opportunity available for a Asset Investment/Business Analyst to join our client for a 12 month fixed term contract (likely extensions/conversion to permanent) in Melbourne CBD.

This will be done through managing project and capital and operating program budgets within SAP and developing trusted stakeholder relationships with other parts of the business.

The main responsibilities of the role are to support the Physicals To Financials and OPEX budgeting, including:
  • Management of the current 2018 plan and development of the 2019 operational maintenance budget and working with other parts of the business to develop the full JGN OPEX budget,
  • Long-term operational maintenance forecasting,

  • Capital Work in Progress (CWIP) monitoring and issues management,
  • CWIP impact on the GIS and Fixed Asset Register,

  • Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills, to plan and resolve issues,
  • Experience in SAP and Excel with proven data analysis skills,

  • Excellent business acumen to make logical and intelligent decisions,

Research Systems Security Compliance Analyst

Company Name Defence Science and Technology Group Company Location Fishermans Bend, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 14 views

Job description

Research Systems Security Compliance Analyst position at Defence Science & Technology


  • Apply your ICT Security skills to scientific innovation and research
  • Contribute to world-class research covering the spectrum of defence capability
  • Be a part of one of Australia’s largest employers of scientists and engineers

Position Classification: S&T 3 through to S&T 4 level position

Salary Range: $66,436 - $91,238 plus 15.4% superannuation

Position Locations: Edinburgh, South Australia, or, Fisherman’s Bend, Victoria

Security Clearance: NV2

Enquiries: Marcus Belder, marcus.belder@dst.defence.gov.au (08) 7389 5595


Defence Science and Technology (DST) is the Australian Government’s lead agency responsible for applying science and technology to safeguard Australia. Our vision is to be a world leader in defence science and technology, indispensable in transforming the Australian Defence Force and Australia’s national security.


DST’s Information Management & Technology Branches (IM&T) provide specialised and advanced scientific computing solutions to keep DST at the forefront of Australian Defence innovation. They provide valuable research ICT services to Defence and National Security operations. IM&T are an integrated, multidisciplined, eResearch capability, fostering a culture of excellence, as well as strong client partnerships dedicated to supporting the research needs of DST.


The Research ICT Security, Risk Management & Compliance Directorate are seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Research ICT Security professional. The successful candidate will administer, operate and provide continuous operational improvements toDST’s scientific computing security.


Experienced candidates looking to enhance their skills and develop a career in Research ICT Security with strong technical skills are encouraged to apply. You will be required to have: \xa02 or more years industry experience; demonstrated experience in ICT security; and have (or be eligible to gain) relevant industry accreditation. The position range allows for applicants in the early stages of their career at the S&T level 3, through to experienced ICT Security professionals at the S&T level 4.

\xa0

At DST you will have the privilege of working with some of Australia’s most talented and world leading scientists and engineers. Our staff enjoy the benefits of Australian Public Service conditions with competitive salary/non-salary packages including lucrative superannuation, as well as flexible, family-friendly working arrangements. We are committed to helping employees balance work and home life with a range of effective policies, practices and social networks. \xa0 We also provide on-the-job training, access to advanced scientific computing learning opportunities, development prospects to grow your scientific computing skill and experience, as well as mentoring to develop your emerging leadership skills and further expand your capability.


For more information and to apply, please follow this link to the position descriptions on the DST website: Research Systems Security Compliance Analyst - Position Description DST/01482/18

Company Name WSP in Australia & New Zealand Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

WSP is one of the world's leading engineering professional services consulting firms, bringing together our 42,000 staff, based in more than 500 offices, across 39 countries to provide engineering and multidisciplinary services in a vast array of industry sectors, with a focus on technical excellence and client service.

Our goal is to be outstanding and we are passionate about remaining at the forefront of technical innovation. That means having the best people, projects and clients, and providing the best service, solutions and advice.

Due to sustained growth WSP is looking for a Principal Electrical Engineer to join our Power engineering team, to be based in Melbourne. Working closely with our Engineering managers for Solar and Wind, you will be focused on managing the delivery of the electrical scope of work associated with our Owners Engineer and Independent Engineer roles across multiple national solar and wind farms, and the associated battery storage. This will include driving technical excellence in the delivery of services from the wider electrical team supporting you locally and nationally. The electrical engineers in the Melbourne team will look to you for guidance and you will be passionate about mentoring and developing less experienced staff. You will be comfortable interfacing with clients, stakeholders and network service providers.

Required Skills And Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
  • At least 10-15 years’ experience preferred, with broad electrical skills and a focus on renewable generation and transmission. Exceptional candidates with fewer years of experience will, however, be considered.
  • Working knowledge of the National Electricity Rules and Generator Performance Standards will be highly regarded.
  • Experience in undertaking independent engineering and due diligence services, and a strong acumen for the associated commercial and reliance issues.
  • Strong interpersonal communication and organisational skills, including the capability to explain complex technical issues to decision-makers and project teams.
  • Must have good English verbal and written communication skills, including report preparation.
  • Ability to work effectively in a client-focused, project-oriented environment.
  • A keen interest and proven experience in mentoring, guiding, and developing less experienced engineers.
While this role is focussed on servicing the renewable energy market, we work as a versatile team so you would be expected to take on other electrical power engineering tasks as project needs arise. Hence, engineering and management skills in other aspects of substation, transmission, generation, rail electrification or other areas power infrastructure would be an advantage.

You will be rewarded with an opportunity to work for one of the largest engineering consultancies in the world along with a career path and supported ongoing professional development for a very successful future.

We are a values-driven consultancy and as such, our selection criteria are simple — we are looking for a team player who values service, integrity, innovation and excellence, and has a strong commitment to their own personal and professional growth.

If you’re ready to join a leader in the engineering consulting world, then it’s time to apply. To express your interest do so by clicking on the 'apply now' button. Your application will be treated in strict confidence.

Please note we will not be engaging the services of recruitment agencies for this role.

Interior Designer

Company Name Gray Puksand Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 81 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Gray Puksand:
\xa0
Gray Puksand is an Australian architecture and integrated design practice with studios in Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney.

Our vision is to create an inspired future with beautiful, authentic and considered projects that improve the way people work, learn and live.

The human experience is at the heart of everything we create. Working across multiple sectors, from education and commercial architecture to workplace and retail design, our design process begins with investigating and truly understanding our clients’ desires and aspirations. We employ our extensive knowledge, research and excellence in design to create future-proof environments.

Individually, we are accomplished, curious, imaginative designers. Collectively, we are a diverse national team, applying a consistent design methodology to deliver successful projects for our clients and the people who inhabit them.
\xa0

About the Role:

We are looking for a Mid-Level Interior Designer, who with a solid foundation looking for their next career step. Join our growing National Interior Design and Workspace team as we continue to produce award winning designs.

You will become part of a growing team of over 10+ passionate and award winning Interior Designers who range in experience from 30+ years’ experience to recent Graduates. You will also join a larger team of over 50+ Architectural and Design professionals in our Melbourne Studio.

If you are someone who is passionate about design and who thrives on a collaboration and outcome driven work, then this is the role for you. As part of a National practice, there will also be exposure to a diverse range of projects across Australia too.

Depending on the size of each project, you be part of a larger design team or be the sole interior designer on smaller projects. Vital to our successes is our ability to communicate designs and ideas through all mediums including Revit and Enscape, Indesign, Photoshop, Sketchup and more progressive design technology including VR.
\xa0
Our Leaders are fantastic, influencers in their field, humble, highly approachable, caring people who believe in supporting and assisting in the development of their team.

This role is based at our Head Studio in the heart of the Melbourne CBD. Our offices are at the cutting edge of ‘work-space design’ so you will be surrounded by an inspiring environment every day.

Getting to work is a breeze as we are located within 5 minutes’ walk from Southern Cross Station and Bourke and Collins street trams. In addition, we have secure onsite bike parking and outstanding change facilities with lockers and free towel service! With on-site yoga, a weekly running group and Corporate Triathlon events, you can find the work-life balance you have been looking for as we believe that a balance life lead to better outcomes for all.


General Duties:
\xa0
  • Contribute to all project phases: concept design, space planning, design development, documentation to on-site construction management and contract administration
  • Contribute to client briefings, workshops, design and design development
  • Create designs and documentations in Revit
  • Prepare presentations and communicate designs in multiple forms; Revit, Enscape, Indesign, Photoshop, Sketchup, VR etc.
  • Work cohesively in a small and larger team

About you:

Ideally you have experience working in workspace and commercial sectors and are looking for an opportunity to grow and develop further.
\xa0
You will need to be passionate about design and need to have strong design, design development and a growing understanding of BCA’s and related building regulations and specifications and construction knowledge. We create design that is inspiring, functional and future proof.

As a national Revit firm, you will need strong Revit skills and an ability to produce drawings up to an acceptable level for design development.

To be successful in this role you will need:
\xa0
  • A Bachelor Degree in Interior Design or Interior Architecture
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in commercial interior design practice or environment
  • Advanced Revit skills
  • Ability to contribute to all project phases: concept design, space planning, design development, documentation to on-site construction management and contract administration
  • A good understanding of the fundamental BCA’s and related building regulations and specifications
  • Strong presentation and rendering skills; Sketch-up, Indesign, Photoshop, Enscape, Rhino, Office Suite will be highly regarded
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to proactively communicate with team members, consultants and clients
  • Demonstrated proactive and collaborative approach to projects
  • Take personal pride and accountability in your work
  • The capacity to work as part of a team with the ability to work autonomously
  • Ability to work on more than one project as required

\xa0
What is on Offer?

For the right person, this role presents the opportunity to take a step up in your career, work with great mentors and exposure to interesting and complex across a variety of industries including, but not limited to; workplace, commercial and education.
\xa0
In addition to this, Gray Puksand can offer:
  • Passionate, highly engaged, respectful, fun-loving, team
  • An empowering and supportive management team
  • A growing national firm who will support your career as it goes from strength to strength
  • High calibre projects which will require innovative and ‘out of the box’ thinking
  • Structured Development, Learning and Mentoring Programs

Furthermore, you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package and ongoing career development.
\xa0
To Apply:
\xa0
Please press the ‘Apply’ button. Please attach your folio as the cover letter (ensure these are compressed to 2MB to comply with the file uploads).
\xa0
Find Out More:
\xa0
To find out more about our projects and practice please go to www.graypuksand.com.au

Job description

Job Description

IBM is the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, serving clients in 170 countries. In this new era of Cognitive Business, IBM is helping to reshape industries by bringing together our expertise in Cloud, Analytics, Security, Mobile, and the Internet of Things. We are changing how we create. How we collaborate. How we analyse. How we engage. IBM is a leader in this global transformation.

Are you interested in helping companies reinvent themselves and their industries for the digital age? Do you want to leverage your business acumen, understanding of cutting edge technology and agile experienc to help enterprises improve their ability to respond to new and ever-changing business strategy? IBM is developing a world-class Digital Strategy Consulting practice which includes a focus on Enterprise Agility and we are hiring the best talent in the industry.

We are seeking experienced consultants with technology proficiency and business acumen who will drive transformation of business component model, technology ecosystem and operating model at the enterprise level. This role works with senior leaders of our clients who want to reconfigure organisational structure and operating rhythm in the New Ways of Working, as well as modernisation of underpinning platforms and processes.

People in this role are able to design transformation strategy and solution roadmap that enable organizations to successfully adopt New Ways of Working enablers at scale. You must have strong logical reasoning, first principles, business acumen, technology proficiency and agile experience to analyse, design and implement transformation initiatives with stakeholders across all levels. People in this role thrive in ambiguity and are passionate about problem solving and effective communication. Communication. People in this role are not afraid to raise issues, challenge the norm and deal with uncertainty.

Successful candidates will have direct evidence of working as part of a major transformation program as a Senior Consultant or as a Strategist within a large enterprise and/or strategy house. Also, you must have profound understanding of industry recognized agile frameworks, optimisation methodologies and emerging technologies with ability to design and implement strategic enterprise transformation programs. The very best candidates will have an entrepreneurial spirit, desire to win and insatiable desire to learn and grow. Also, you will exhibit exemplary behaviours and drive cultural change through their action.

Responsibilities
  • Proactively support the growth of Enterprise Agility and Technology & Data Strategy practice
  • Deliver advisory service engagements and drive enterprise transformation at the strategic level
  • Define areas of problem or improvement opportunities with clear connection to the solution
  • Conduct effective envision, discovery and design session with diverse stakeholder groups
  • Analyse data and synthesize insights into stories and journey map
  • Devise conceptual solution with principles and construct scalable across the organisation
  • Exhibit exemplary agile practices, behaviour and culture
  • Upkeep currency of latest agile practices, emerging technology landscape and industry trends

Preferred Technical And Professional Experience
  • 4 years of general consulting or other equivalent business experience
  • 1 year of experience working for a large enterprise or top tier consulting firm developing business strategies for clients or leading transformation initiatives or equivalent experience
  • 2 years of involvement in at least one aspect of a digital transformation (e.g. emerging technology, data monetisation, business modelling, digital marketing, cognitive processing)
  • 1 year of experience developing proposals and responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs)
  • In depth experience working with businesses in at least one industry
  • Willingness to travel (domestically and globally) up to 4 days a week
  • Strong academic results, MBA highly desirable
  • Fluent in English

Career Growth

Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we have kicked off an internal talent strategy program. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through:
  • Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skills
  • Finding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirations
  • Diversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovation

see above

Procurement Account Lead

Company Name Philip Morris International Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 27 minutes ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At PMI we value a culture that is built on professionalism, reputation and pride. You experiment, learn and succeed. Whether you work with us for one year or ten, you will learn the skills that open doors to any career you want.

In 2016 and 2017, our company was recognised by the Australian Government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an employer of choice for gender equality. This recognition was part of our commitment to being a great place to work that puts our employees at the centre of our business and develops world class talent.

Are you inquisitive and self-driven? Will you make a difference to our company and your colleagues around you? If you answered yes, then we want to hear from you.

BEND THE NORM

We offer you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. With innovative technologies, services, and processes, backed by a competitive salary package and a flexible working environment, you will work in a professional setting with colleagues all over the world to achieve Philip Morriss role in the decision-making process
• Developing and executing the agreed category strategy by delivering both short and long term solutions and practices to reduce cost
• Applying sound knowledge of business dynamics and procurement categories (spend, supply base, and market trends) to interpret and anticipate macroeconomic trends, industry activities and evaluate suppliers.
• Focussing on delivering cost savings as per agreed business targets
• Lead sourcing projects, requiring you to manage significant negotiations
• Drive strategic planning of procurement cycles with our global and regional offices to increase procurement efficiency within our business.

INNOVATION STARTS WITH TRYING

We’re looking for someone who has

• A high level of business acumen, demonstrating credibility when engaging senior stakeholders
• Proactive customer service management
• A solid knowledge of the sourcing and Procure to Pay process
• Demonstrated capability in network building and working across multiple time zones with international teams
• A minimum of 4 years’ experience in procurement at local regional category level with specialization in one or more categories
• Evidence of further education through either nationally accredited Supply Chain training or relevant tertiary qualifications is desirable

SHARE OUR VISION

We’ve built the world’s most successful cigarette company, with the world’s most popular and iconic brands.

Now we’ve made a dramatic decision.

We will be far more than a leading cigarette company. We’re building PMI’s future on smoke-free products that are a much better choice than cigarette smoking.
Indeed, our vision – for all of us at PMI – is that these products will one day replace cigarettes.

Why are we doing this?

Because we should...

We understand the millions of men and women who smoke cigarettes. They are looking for less harmful, yet satisfying, alternatives to smoking. We will give them that choice.

We have a commitment to our employees and our shareholders. We will fulfil that commitment by pursuing this long-term vision for success.

Society expects us to act responsibly. And we are doing just that by designing a smoke-free future.

…and because we now can.

Success in the cigarette business gives us the resources to pursue our ambitious vision.

Thanks to the imagination and perseverance of thousands of people at PMI, we have developed breakthrough products that are smoke-free and enjoyable.

And, we are selling them today. Millions have already given up smoking and switched to our new products, and this is just the beginning.
We’re investing to make these products the Philip Morris icons of the future.

A future PMI that’s known for replacing cigarettes with a portfolio of revolutionary products.

In changing times you can always choose to do nothing. Instead, we’ve set a new course for the company. We’ve chosen to do something really big.

Candidates must legally be able to work in Australia.

Applications close Monday, 1 October 2018.

Unlimit Yourself @ PMI

  • Tobacco

Full-time

  • Purchasing
  • Supply Chain

Principal Developer Payment Solutions

Company Name MYOB Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description


Principal Developer - Payments

This role is based in our Glen Waverley office.

Who are we?

We are a tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe business can do amazing things and it’s our job to help them. This is MYOB.

What will I be doing in this role?

You’ll be part of our new Payment Solutions division and join a growing engineering team responsible for building and operating a range of payment related products and services that will drive MYOB’s foray into the rapidly growing payment services sector.

We believe a large market exists within small and medium businesses to use core payments services to drive efficiencies in their business and to improve their cashflow requirements. The adoption of digital payments is on the rise and the growth of new and emerging payment channels such as digital wallets, e-invoicing, mobile devices, NPP, etc. means this is an exciting domain with endless opportunities.

We empower our teams to innovate and experiment when solving the important problems for our clients who are at the center of everything we do. With the latest tech at your disposal and an agile mindset, we are looking for people who are passionate about making a difference and are ready to go boldly?

A day in the life of a Developer at MYOB

As a business and within our teams we are focused on making things easier, finding new ways of doing things, kicking goals and being results driven, and our passion is shown by the love that we have for our work.

We have created working spaces that encourage open and collaborative ways of working, with pair programming being the norm. Why? Because we believe we are better together.

You will be part of a collaborative cross functional agile team, surrounded by our engineering and experience team members of Product Managers; Designers; Business Analysts; Agile Coaches; Quality Analysts and DevOps Engineers. Your team members are often seen at conferences, meet ups (industry events) sharing their expert knowledge & experiences.

Our mission is to ensure that our Developers can craft software that they can deploy and take ownership of.

What do I need to be considered?

Ideally as a Principal Developer you will have a strong understanding of software principles and practices such as clean code and continuous delivery.

  • You are primarily an amazing Java full-stack developer who is comfortable learning and applying a variety of languages, frameworks and platforms such as JavaScript, Ruby, Node.js, React, Angular and AWS (Windows and Linux)
  • You love to coach and mentor your team mates
  • An advocate of test driven development and creating clean and maintainable code
  • You like to deploy regularly and focus on continuous delivery and automated deployments
  • We are a highly collaborative team and you are comfortable working closely with your colleagues on a daily basis (such as pair- and mob-programming)
  • You have the willingness to work in a DevOps environment with a build-it, run-it mentality
  • Love to learn! Read books and blogs, try new things in technology
  • Lastly, you want to work in a positive environment, grow yourself and work within a team. You want to Love Your Work!
  • Your work influences and inspires others
If you want to work and collaborate where opinions are valued and your ideas can make a difference, you need to work at MYOB. We look forward to meeting you.

Employment Type

Full-time

  • Engineering
  • Information Technology

Job description


Melbourne based Travel business is looking for a General Manager for Australia and New Zealand.


The company offers tailor-made holiday packages to accommodate for the most bespoke requests for a wide variety of customers across Australia.


The business operates through a B2B/C model, working with a wide variety of large and independent travel agents.


The successful candidate will have experience across Operations, Finance, Strategy and Commercial Development, ideally in Travel.


About the Role


The General Manager will lead the business in Australia and New Zealand in conjunction with the Board. The successful candidate will be responsible for driving commercial success through the development of a strategic plan.


The General Manager will be responsible for:

  • Leading, managing and implementing the long and short-term plans in accordance with the overall strategic plan
  • Ensure the business is appropriately staffed and develop a culture of commercial success
  • Manage all budgets in accordance with the CFO
  • Ascertain how the business is performing and ensure all risks are resolved in timely and suitable manner
  • Identify trends to support growth
  • Review company performance and implement strategic and operations changes to promote commercial success
  • Ensure the business has the appropriate systems to enable commercial success
  • Deliver agreed budgeted EBIT & Net Profit.


About the Candidate


This is a fantastic opportunity for Senior Leaders who are looking for a challenging but rewarding position within a business with huge potential.


The successful candidate will need to have a proven track record of dynamic leadership and commercial success, the candidate will also have:

  • Strong negotiation, presentation and communications skills
  • Solid understanding of the latest technology within the Tourism, Travel, Hospitality or Leisure sector
  • Extensive experience in Marketing, Sales and Brand Management
  • Evidence of strong Business Development ability
  • Track record of leading sustainable, profitable growth
  • Strong corporate governance and board management skills
  • Strong financial literacy
  • Excellent understanding of the B2B model within Travel and Tourism


About the Company


The business, based in South Melbourne has three major brands operating across Australia and New Zealand. The business is focused on providing their customers with a unique, bespoke holiday package, regardless of booking size or complexity.

Advisor Diversity & Inclusion
Job no: 570864

  • Convenient CBD location

  • $85,065 + 17% super

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

The Education Portfolio is headed by the Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education and Vice President who leads the planning and implementation of the University’s strategies related to RMIT’s academic programs and the RMIT student experience. The Portfolio is responsible for services to support the quality of RMIT programs, including the professional development of academic staff, continuous improvement of the student experience, learning and teaching outcomes and the management of learning and research information sources.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Advisor Diversity and Inclusion will support the University’s Access and Equity projects, including the Diversity and Inclusion Framework and related Action Plans, by designing and delivering a number of projects and initiatives, engaging collaboratively with a range of stakeholders. This role will have a focus on supporting access and successful participation by students from under-represented groups.

Skills & Experience Required

As the successful candidate you will demonstrate understanding of community diversity, with the proven capacity to draw upon related skills and expertise to develop and deliver equity and inclusion programs that are targeted and responsive. In addition, you will demonstrate ability to identify, develop, and deliver a range of innovative and effective programs. High-level written and oral communication skills, including experience in the design and delivery of training and information resources, and the proven ability to liaise at all levels with a culturally diverse group of people will be imperative to your success in this role.

The opportunity?


As part of Toll Group's new growth strategy an exciting opportunity has arisen for a Transport Supervisor to join our Express Parcels division. This role will be managing daily transport operations across a group of drivers. You will work with the team to lift engagement and process improvement through your zone. The ideal candidate?

Creative Studio | Global focus | Digital transformation project

The role

We are looking for a Digital Marketing Leader to join us for a 12-month contract (parental leave replacement). This is a senior role where you’ll be responsible for leading and implementing key brand and digital marketing transformation projects that support our business strategy, improve our digital brand experience and support our global expansion.

You’ll be working with our agency partners to build better digital brand experiences across all our owned, earned and paid marketing channels and platforms including web, email and social media.

You’ll be primarily responsible for leading the development of the new HASSELL and FreeState website and blog projects and new email marketing strategy.

You will report to the Head of Marketing and Communications and will collaborate with our senior brand leadership group including CEO, MD and Heads of Design along with the wider network of Principals, leaders and the business. You’ll also be responsible for leading the in-house team and agencies working closely with you on these projects.

About You

You are a strategic marketing practitioner with 8+ years’ experience in both B2B and B2C environments. Ideally, you will have spent six years working in digitally focused roles across all elements of paid, owned and earned digital media, preferably for creative, global brands.

You love all things digital, and will have worked on developing and implementing multiple organisation wide digital marketing strategies that include website re-development and blog projects (preferably for complex organisations with sub-brands and/or microsites). You will need to be just as comfortable developing content marketing strategies as you are implementing them across web, email, social and marketing automation platforms.

A natural self-starter and communicator, you’ll also have experience managing agency relationships, leading high performing teams and be comfortable working in-house in a fast-paced internal agency environment.

Why HASSELL?

We consider our people to be our greatest resource. With that in mind, we place great emphasis on attracting, retaining and developing the best talent. We place value on the quality of ideas and the contribution our people make to our open and collaborative culture. We support innovation and creativity to enable exceptional design outcomes.

We value diversity, employing people across a number of regions, representing many different cultures and ethnic backgrounds.

_Creative studio working environment
_Inter studio transfer opportunities
_Development and training
_Wellbeing benefits
_Flexible start and finish times, part time and job share arrangements
_Professional memberships
_Study assistance.

If you aspire to create great digital experiences, and are looking to take the next step in your career with an international design practice, this is the role for you.
